Meng Cui

Principal Investigator

Meng is an assistant professor of Electrical Engineering and Biology at Purdue University. He obtained his Ph.D degree from Physics of University of Michigan at Ann Arbor. Between 2010 and 2015, Meng is a Janelia Lab Head at Howard Hughes Medical Institute. Located in Bindley Bioscience Center, Meng freely pursues his newfound passion of integrated imaging system development. Currently, Meng is learning to build the synergy of teaching, mentoring and research in a fresh scholarly environment.

Bowen Wei

Ph.D. Student

Bowen received his BS degree in Physics from USTC, China. At Purdue ECE, Bowen is expanding his horizons in innovative approaches of imaging system design and development. In his spare time, Bowen enjoys swimming, table tennis and skateboarding.

Chenmao Wang

Ph.D. Student

Chenmao received his BS degree in Electronic Engineering from Tianjin University, China. In this lab, Chenmao mainly focus on wavefront correction and imaging system design. This is a new area for him which he is interested in. He also has interests in computation imaging. In his spare time, Chenmao enjoys watching movie and swimming.

Hehai Jiang

Ph.D. Student

Hehai started his journey in optical imaging after receiving B.S. in Applied Physics from Nankai University. Hehai is excited to explore the secret in large-volume, high-resolution imaging system at Purdue. During the spare time, he is fond of climbing, swimming and cooking.

Jianian Lin

Ph.D. Student

Jianian received his BS degree in Physics from USTC China. At Purdue ECE, Jianian is currently working on high-speed imaging system. In his spare time, Jianian enjoys comics and basketball.

Sun Shiyi

Ph.D. Student

Shiyi received her BS degree in Optical science and Engineering from Zhejiang University. She is expanding her horizons in large field of view imaging techniques in biological imaging. In her spare time, Shiyi enjoys watching movies, baking and hiking.

Tao Zhou

Visiting Scholar

Tao, receiving his BS degree is Electronic and Information Engineering from Hangzhou Dianzi University, is a visiting scholar at Purdue ECE since August, 2019. Tao is interested in Embedded System, FPGA based Algorithm Acceleration and Mixed Signal Processing. Tao enjoys rock climbing, bike riding and reading in leisure time.

Ke Si, Professor of Optical Science and Engineering, Zhejiang University, China.

Reto Fiolka, Assistant professor of cell biology at UT southwestern (top ten cell biology program in U.S.)
